alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Mitchell, western Jewell, northern Smith, southeastern Franklin and southwestern Webster Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Smith Center to near Ionia. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and spotty pockets of hail up to around penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mankato, Burr Oak and Riverton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
